content.description:
Juno Arranges a Marriage

Conubio iungamiungo, -ere: to join1 stabilistabilis, -e, adj.: stable propriamproprius, -a, -um, adj.: your ownque2 dicabodico, -are: to declare, 
omnes ut tecum meritismeritum, -i, n. = praemium, -i pro talibus annos 
exigat3 et pulchra faciat te proleproles, -is, f.: offspring parentem.
 1:Supply eam tibi (eam refers to a nymph named Deiopea).↩
2:Supply eam (referring to the nymph Deiopea).↩
3:The subject of exigat is the nymph Deiopea.↩
content.question: In line 1, conubio iungam stabili is translated

choices.label: I am joining the stability of a marriage with you
I am marrying her joined to you in stability
I will join her to you in a stable marriage
I will join the stable marriage with you

content.answer: I will join her to you in a stable marriage

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry
